title: Who'd win? A highly trained Samurai with years of experience or two rusty tin cans?

replies.body:
My body wasn't ready for the rape upon arriving the comment section.

Like, seriously.

Rape is a strong word and shouldn't be used casually.
I used to use the word a lot like "hahah you got raped" but I understand now how stupid I was.
I really hate people (often youths) that joke about rape, I'm not gonna reply to you if you respond to this.
Part of humor is making light of dark things, and rape is a dark thing indeed, so it needs some humor.
LUL GOOD ONE

I will contact the support and ask them to remove admin rights from that mod.

What a fucking joke.

I understand this to an extent, I laugh at racist jokes and stuff, even those against my own race. I feel that people just use the word so casually, especially for youths and that is an issue. When people use the word because something 'bad' happened to them they say 'x raped me' or 'you got raped by x' I just disapprove entirely. However you get those drop the soap jokes and I can see the humor in that and I do laugh. It is like using the N word in a sense, a horrible word when used so casually if you ask me but I think it is fine in humor.

I also wouldn't say it needs humor.

Well, it has humor injected into it by people regardless. I watch some horrible, horrible videos often enough and even in those videos people are going to make light of what they're seeing, in part because it's who they are, and in another part because it makes for an effective coping mechanism. 

Everything receives humor of some sort. Rape is not an exception to that just because we will it to be. I wouldn't joke about it myself, but I can't stop other people from doing so.

Of course, humor covers everything. I'm fine with humor made about rape, although I am pretty against it, I'm also against people littering but I'm not gonna start hating these people. When used so casually and in an everyday sense though, that is when I think a line should start being made. You don't know who is reading what you're saying or who is listening nearby and also I feel it's just too wrong morally.

I hate to sound crass and uncaring (because I really do care about what people think and feel) but sometimes you just have to be prepared to see things that are going to bother you, in any situation. We can do our best to help them out, which is why I personally don't joke about those topics, but since we can't see ahead of time what's going to bother people, we can't reasonably force everyone to censor themselves for the off-chance that someone will be around and bothered by it. More than just rape bothers people, after all. Abuse is relatively often referenced and joked about as well, but that one doesn't get as much attention despite the potential for being as traumatic as rape can be. I've seen many haunting things and had to deal with a lot of terrible things, I have to be prepared to be reminded of those things any time I go online. 

To be clear, don't confuse what I'm saying with accusing them of being weak or easily bothered or thin-skinned or anything like that, but after a certain time they don't have to necessarily "get over it" (how do you "get over" rape or abuse, after all?) but they will need to find a way to deal with it being brought up in some way, even if it's hard. That's just life, unfortunately. Life is hard. :\

Also, this applies mostly to other places. I think Riot has a no-rape type of policy they can enforce, so realistically people shouldn't joke about rape if for no other reason than not violating the rules they agreed to, but not every place necessarily has this rule, and in those places you can't expect people to censor themselves against what might bother someone else.
Nope you dont sound crass at all, this is something I fully understand.

But let's be honest, you really don't care about that do you. You care about being on the moral high ground here, people know the difference between reaility and fiction. They're not going to start thinking sexual assault is alright just because the word for it is used in a light term.  

Plus, you're trying to censor free speech based on what YOU want. Who the fuck are you? I understand if it's around a rape victim (obviously), but who are you to say what people can't and can say?

I dont care about moral high ground because I have my own sense of morals. The thing is when people use the word rape in such a casual everyday like way I feel they are not 

I am not trying to censor free speech. I think people should not use the word in a casual everyday kind of way. I dont think the rape should never be talked about, complete opposite actually.

Also I dont think highly of myself at all.

Yeah, bullshit. You clearly felt as if your morals were superior to his when you posted the comment, I mean why else would you post it? You felt as if your judgement was better than his (it wasn't) so you told him what to do. 

When everyone called you out on your bullshit you started to backpedal.

There are words for it.

Inappropriate / Disturbing.

Choose where you use it! Definetly not on a public forum for a PG12 game.
"PG12" game meanwhile {{champion:1}} gets dunked in half by {{champion:122}}
Hate is a strong word and shouldn't be used casually.

You're right, I don't think my wording was directly related to how I feel as well. I look down upon those who use the word rape so nonchalantly but I know that I don't hate these people if they have this one trait.

So i guess better wording for myself would be look down upon, disapprove, dislike, something along those lines.

>nonchalantly

I do believe there is a difference between not shunning the act behind the word and not being able to use the fucking word.

_“If you can't joke about the most horrendous things in the world, what's the point of jokes? What's the point in having humor? Humor is to get us over terrible things.”_
Can you extend? I think using the word is okay, just not so casually as in saying it regularly whenever X happens.

>Can you extend?

I believe it was supposed to be either "explain" or "elaborate", so...

Check top comments.

They were removed.
Because rape isn't "cool".

I meant can you extend on your points here:

>I do believe there is a difference between not shunning the act behind the word and not being able to use the fucking word.

I guess I'll try to extend it on my own. Difference in shunning the rape in reality and not being able to use the word. That all I can get out of this, I don't see much of a comparison that could be made because the topics are purely different.

I've repeated myself numerous times here, most of which breaking many assumptions people are making of me. I am fine with the word being used as well, I am against it being used so casually in response to some simple situation, "wow I got raped". I don't think such a strong word could be used so simply without thought, I don't think the word should be forbidden though. I have laughed at many dropping of soap jokes.
I agree that rape is a pretty insensitive thing to joke about, however, I think it's a little unfair of you to expect them to conform to what you think is appropriate or not.
Same here mate. Like really?

Meanwhile, KoKoboto's posts still stands. Like WTF!?

Did the mods give you a valid reason for deleting yours? I can't respect them enough to even see what they wrote in my case.

Welcome to the Land of the Free.

You are "Free" only when it aligns with _our_ opinions.
Sad, but apparently true.

You know what's even sadder?
That a comment which literally spells "rape rape rape" is still here.

If I was a mod, I'd remove it. Wanna know why?

For spam, not because it's not "cool" to joke about rape.

Yeah, I see it. 
And I am REALLY tempted to take this higher now!

What the hell sort of dictators do the mods think that they are!?

I mean, you did agree to an electronic contract with Riot by making your account. Land of the Free only applies to federal jurisdiction; Riot doesn't have to maintain the illusion of free speech at all if they don't want to because you signed a contract explicitly with them based on their terms, meaning your First Amendment bears no power here.

Though I wish they were more consistent sometimes.

Just because I signed a contract doesn't mean the contract itself can violate the law.

As for consistency, I could give two shits about the in-game one, but the Boards need a strict set of rules that everybody must follow, instead of vague guidelines that anybody can interpret their own way.

For example some time ago I posted a meme with a spider burying in white sand with word "cocaine" in captions and it was removed, because _"talking about drugs and non-prescribed drugs (...) violates Universal Rules"_ while the Universal Rules only say _"Illegal Activities or Drugs (...) please don’t talk about your activities or plans on these boards"_.

At this point I'm sure I know Riot's own rules better than they do, which is very sad.

>Hey MadKnife IV,

>While we do allow a number of topics that can be discussed about, there are some areas of discussion >which are not cool to joke about.

>The post has been removed and quoted below:

>"Upvoted because of the Yasuo ****"

What a joke

>If you don't want to respond, that's fine. You're right, the word "rape" shouldn't be used casually., but there is a difference (sometimes a fine line, agreed) between an offense and used casually.

It's ironic he even went that way, since people in USA have been crying rape on any mild offence for years now.

>(...) as a Nami player in particular (...)
>Peace and #r34

http://i.imgur.com/ZhjZCdc.jpg?b

Careful - that #tag just got a moderator on the case. :|
I sorta knew it just now when I only got " ********************** " when trying to edit the post.

So much for a minor indiscretion joke while trying to make a serious point...

You wouldn't happen to have this page open wih the entire post in it, so you can copy the whole thing and send me for an edited repost?

Damn useless mods, just shuffling around deleting at will without reason or proper cause!

I didn't, but I had it in my recently closed tabs.

How do you want me to send it? In-game?

Thanks for the offer, but I just found it myself...it was all in the "warning" I received. Apparently, only describing the truth of what happened in the image in the first post was "uncool to discuss".

Like they rather missed the context COMPLETELY!! on that one!

So the mods are not only useless, but apparently blind as well. Well, guess that explains the reason for their uselessness then...

#@ Mods: Read the bloody context, you daft sods!

>So the mods are not only useless, but apparently blind as well. Well, guess that explains the reason for their uselessness then...

You think why I'm not using my main account to post anymore?

>Thanks for the offer

But... but... [butt](http://www.savingcountrymusic.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/george-michael-butt-dana-carvey-2.jpg)... you were the one who asked me to send it to you. 

>but I found it...

http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/facebook/000/059/324/1279165661008.jpg
Like I said, I appreciate your willingness to assist with my request, but I found it myself. Can't elaborate further, else the führer mods might come blitzing in.

>else the führer mods might come blitzing in.

I can nazi a reason for that to happen.
I don't think they need a reason. Another thing they have in common.
You know you are going to _heil_ for not following my pun, _Reich_?

I got it, don't worry. ;)

Just couldn't say it outright because of the mods.

Believe me when I say, I had this image in the next tab sitting for two weeks not doing anything... and then I used it twice on the same day.

>_And when I finally found a Garen-free bush too..._

http://pa1.narvii.com/6307/1284ae8e90b8094b91fb0be6ddb59888cea2d327_hq.gif

"Getting raped" refers to getting beat in a game insanely hard. It's a synonym for getting stomped.

While I agree that some things (like the infamous "kys") are stupid and should not be used I find it highly offensive that you think you are someone more mature when, in fact, you act like a very fragile person due to getting offended by what I wrote.

Getting raped in an online game is in no way an equivalent to getting raped IRL. People confusing or even mixing those 2 phrases up REALLY need to get away from gaming for a while, because they lost the contact to the real world.
